title: The Mitten
text:
The Mitten () is a bare flat-topped <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, which resembles a <a href="mitten">mitten</a> when viewed from above, standing northwest of <a href="Mount%20Armytage">Mount Armytage</a> in <a href="Victoria%20Land">Victoria Land</a>, <a href="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>. It was named by the Southern Party of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Geological%20Survey%20Antarctic%20Expedition">New Zealand Geological Survey Antarctic Expedition</a> of 1962–63 because of its <a href="mitten">mitten</a>-like shape.
Thumb Point is a rock spur extending from the northwest side of The Mitten, named because the feature resembles the thumb on a mitten.
